DataElement.preferredName: Metastatic Neoplasm Histologic Confirmation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the histologic verification of metastatic disease as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Metastatic Neoplasm Histologic Confirmation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology._Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._Having been established or verified._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.

Property.preferredName: Histologic Confirmation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.:Having been established or verified.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have histologica
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed progressive, metastatic castration resistant prostate adenocarcinoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed locally advanced or metastatic pancreas cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed new diagnosis of breast cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically determined grade 2 or 3 tumor by the FNCLCC sarcoma grading system?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a histologically confirmed diagnosis of metastatic invasive triple negative breast cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically proven prostate adenocarcinoma confirmed by a CLIA certified laboratory?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have progressive castration-resistant prostate cancer with two or more skeletal metastases identified by 99mTC bone scintigraph that has been histologically confirmed at any time point?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed sarcoma with FGFR alteration identified by next-generation sequencing profiling with the exception of SDH-deficient GIST who can be enrolled regardless of FGFR status?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have progressive castration-resistant prostate cancer with two or more skeletal metastases identified by Tc-99m bone scintigraphy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have sarcoma or non-epithelial histology?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic, histologically confirmed well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor with positive Dotatate scan (Gallium-68 or Copper-64) within 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of metastatic advanced cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic, histologically confirmed well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor with positive gallium 68 DOTATATE or copper 64 DOTATATE scan?
